name: Green Salad
history: Green Salad is a staple in various cuisines worldwide, known for its simplicity and health benefits. Each region uses different types of greens based on local availability, leading to a diverse range of salad recipes.
description: This Green Salad is a blend of specific leafy greens, providing a range of flavors and textures. It includes lettuce, spinach, and arugula, combined with other fresh vegetables and a light dressing, making it a nutritious and refreshing dish.

instructions.title: Prepare the Greens
instructions.description: Wash and dry the lettuce, spinach, and arugula. Tear or chop them into bite-sized pieces.

instructions.title: Combine Ingredients
instructions.description: In a salad bowl, combine the lettuce, spinach, arugula, cucumber, green bell pepper, and spring onions.

instructions.title: Dress the Salad
instructions.description: Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice over the salad. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Toss well to combine.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped parsley or cilantro. Serve the salad immediately as a side dish or a light main course.

tips: Using a mix of different greens provides a variety of nutrients and flavors.
Add nuts, seeds, or cheese for extra texture and richness.
variations: Incorporate other types of greens like kale or Swiss chard.
Top with grilled chicken, shrimp, or tofu for added protein.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. If needed, can be refrigerated for a few hours.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in a large, colorful bowl to enhance the appeal of the fresh ingredients.
Garnish with edible flowers for an elegant touch.
